name: redoubtably
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
very strongly, especially in character: Once again, she plays the redoubtably glamorous grandmother. The board delivered a redoubtably tough response to the media.
More examplesFewer examplesIn the hands of its redoubtably traditional editors, the paper soon attained a substantial circulation. The human rights lawyer is played redoubtably by the Oscar-winning actress.Most of Monmouthshire is firmly and redoubtably Welsh, but the area along the River Wye has more in common with the landscape over the border in England.
